result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Monica Jean Eades

records.addlTxt:
Case called: 1:34 p.m. 
Clerk: Heather.      
State appears by ADA Alex Lech; Defendant appears w/Atty Paul Rohloff;

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

PLEA:
CT 1 (Theft - Business Setting <=$2500)>>NO CONTEST.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & defendant guilty;
 
COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 12 months for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to AMEND to: Theft 9.32, $50.00 forfeiture.

COURT amends bond to remove condition of ATTIC pretrial services. 

DEOJ RH>> 10/03/2023 at 1:10 p.m.
Bond continues.

Adjourned: 1:43 p.m.
Final pre-trial on October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
ADA Lech appears; Atty Rohloff appears via phone; Offer exchanged; Future dates set;

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on August 3, 2022 at 10:40 am.

Case called: 2:58 p.m. 
Clerk: Heather.      
Defendant appears in person, pro se.

COURT questions defendant re: employment/income;
Court finds defendant indigent.
COURT appoints Atty Paul Rohloff @ $100/hr not to exceed $800.00 w/o further order;

Adj: 3:00 p.m.

No contact with victim(s): The Store in Weston, WI. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.
